title: Rhode Island Route 24
text:
Route 24 is a limited-access <a href="state%20highway">state highway</a> in the <a href="U.S.%20state">U.S. state</a> of <a href="Rhode%20Island">Rhode Island</a>. It runs approximately from <a href="Rhode%20Island%20Route%20114">Route 114</a> in <a href="Portsmouth%2C%20Rhode%20Island">Portsmouth</a> to <a href="Massachusetts%20Route%2024">Massachusetts Route 24</a> in <a href="Fall%20River%2C%20Massachusetts">Fall River, Massachusetts</a>. Route 24 is the primary freeway access for the two towns in the southeastern corner of the state, <a href="Tiverton%2C%20Rhode%20Island">Tiverton</a> and <a href="Little%20Compton%2C%20Rhode%20Island">Little Compton</a>. Though on the mainland, they are isolated from the rest of the state by an arm of the <a href="Narragansett%20Bay">Narragansett Bay</a>. Because of this, the main freeway connection to <a href="Providence%2C%20Rhode%20Island">Providence</a> involves using Rhode Island Route 24, <a href="Massachusetts%20Route%2024">Massachusetts Route 24</a>, and <a href="Interstate%20195%20%28Rhode%20Island%E2%80%93Massachusetts%29">Interstate 195</a>.
Route description.
Route 24 starts at <a href="Rhode%20Island%20Route%20114">Route 114</a> in <a href="Portsmouth%2C%20Rhode%20Island">Portsmouth</a>. It heads northeast and has a short concurrency with <a href="Rhode%20Island%20Route%20138">Route 138</a> over the <a href="Sakonnet%20River%20Bridge">Sakonnet River Bridge</a> to <a href="Tiverton%2C%20Rhode%20Island">Tiverton</a>. It continues northeast until the border with <a href="Fall%20River%2C%20Massachusetts">Fall River, Massachusetts</a>, where it continues as <a href="Massachusetts%20Route%2024">Massachusetts Route 24</a>.
Exit list.
Exits were formerly numbered only on <a href="gore%20%28highway%29">gore</a> signs until 2014, when a project put numbers on all signs except for at Fish Road. All interchanges in Rhode Island, including Route 24, will be renumbered to mileage-based numbers by 2020 under a plan announced by RIDOT in the fall of 2017. In November 2019, RIDOT announced that Route 24 will be renumbering the exits in Spring 2020.
